Name: Военно-морская игра
Description:
"Ð’Ð¾ÐµÐ½Ð½Ð¾-Ð¼Ð¾Ñ€ÑÐºÐ°Ñ Ð¸Ð³Ñ€Ð°" (eng. "Naval game") is a pre-revolution Russian board game similar to Chess, 1907 made in Saint Petersburg. 
From the carine government in 1908 this game won a bronze medal.

Each player controls 10 playing pieces - different warships.
Game play: At the beginning, the game figures are placed in specific squares on the game board (always the same as specified in the instructions). As in Chess, the different figures/ships moves on the game board in different ways and are removed when the square is occupied by another player.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Admiral ship (like a king).

Name: Haste Worte?: Das 2. wortreiche Würfelspiel
Description:
Roll the dice, choose a theme, combine motifs and write down words! Whoever finds the most words that no one else has written down wins! With Haste Worte - Das wortreiche Würfelspiel, 8 colorful dice have already joined the Haste Worte family. Starting in 2021, the dice will be supplemented with Haste Worte - Das 2. wortreiche Würfelspiel (You have Words? - The 2nd Wordy Dice Game) and feature new motifs for even more creative and witty rounds of play!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Murder Off Miami
Description:
Documents, photographs, police and criminal reports, and pieces of evidence presented in the order they are received by Florida detective Kettering contain clues that allow the reader to determine who murdered British financier Bolitho Blane.

An early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Balkans
Description:
The Balkans, also known as the Balkan Peninsula, is a geographic area in Southeast Europe with various geographical and historical definitions.The region takes its name from the Balkan Mountains that stretch throughout the whole of Bulgaria. The Balkan Peninsula is bordered by the Adriatic Sea in the northwest, the Ionian Sea in the southwest, the Aegean Sea in the south, the Turkish Straits in the east, and the Black Sea in the northeast. The northern border of the peninsula is variously defined. The highest point of the Balkans is Mount Musala, 2,925 metres (9,596 ft), in the Rila mountain range, Bulgaria.

This expansion takes place in this beautiful area. It is designed for 3-4 players. The expansion uses the same rules as the original game, with the following exception: the 'Production' action is replaced with the 'Roma' action.

Name: Intrighi e Missive
Description:
This game was attached in ioGioco Magazine 23

Europe between the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries is that of the great absolutist monarchies where politics, diplomacy and war are decided in the gilded lounges ... or between the sheets of the alcoves.
Myriads of small states fragment the continent, becoming pawns in a complicated game between the Powers of Austria, France, England and Spain.
Their ambassadors have much of the adventurer: partly bankers and partly spies, they are skilled double agents who know how to juggle the intrigues of the Court.

Intrighi e Missive ("Intrigue and Missive") is a strategic game of conquest and war, where battles are won also thanks to the missions of our emissaries in the courts of the adversaries. Each of them will bring a secret message (white or black) which, once revealed, will trigger special actions capable of changing the balance between the powers.

Name: STOP by ZERO
Description:
STOP by ZERO is a push your luck card game from Japan. Players draw cards from a deck. The cards show numbers with either + or x for addition or multiplication. As players accumulate cards, they increase the player's score. But if they draw a x0 card, their score is now zero.
user summary

Name: Hollywood Racers: Racers of the Lost Arena
Description:
Your races can now be played by up to 6 players!

10 new Drivers! 3 new boards! 2 new Managers! 3 new gaming modes (Solo, Arena and Championship)

Name: Operation Nordwind 1945: The Last German Offensive in the West
Description:
Operation Nordwind 1945 is an introductory level, card-assisted game depicting Germany’s last offensive in the west from December 31, 1944 – January 20, 1945. The game concentrates on the fighting that took place in the mountainous, heavily-forested terrain of the Alsace region of France. Historically, the German offensive failed in its attempt to secure the Saverne Gap – needed to unleash its Panzers in order to cut off the U.S. Seventh Army and perhaps gain a political settlement to the war in the west.

- From the Publisher

Name: Contraseña
Description: An Argentinian 1990's logical deduction word game.

Name: Iguana James
Description:
An Argentinian 1996 deduction and adventure game.

You find yourself in the exotic, timeless, hot city of Al Habub, in the shoes of archaeologist and adventurer Iguana James. As Iguana, you solve all kinds of cases that your friends and enemies throw at you. To do so, look for clues in the most interesting places in the city, from the Posada de los Ladrones to the Pythonisa's house, from the Museum to the editorial office of the Dromediario. You can declare Sites of Archaeological Interest to prevent your opponents from advancing... or you can open Sites of Interest etc. declared by them. You can use the Talisman of Swift Foot to move quickly through the city. And all to identify the culprit, explain the unlikely, and have a beer in the company of the old barman.

Name: Tango de Mente
Description:
An Argentinian 1990's card game about tango.


This is a very original and entertaining board game. The box (black) contains the rules (red) in Spanish and English and the cards (blue box). Illustrated by Hermenegildo SÃ¡bat, it is a purely porteño game made up of characters such as the Chanta, the Curda, the Muñeca Brava, the Viejita, and Carlos Gardel, among others.

—description from Museo del Libro "Gardel y su Tiempo"


Play a tango!

From the stories that tango lyrics tell, Tango de Mente was born, a new deck and a pastime to practice with friends.

Sitting the players at the table, the cards come and go. When playing Curda, the values are reversed and a lower number wins over a higher number. Where the Chanta appears, the best card does not win, but the one that follows in value. Muñeca Brava beats any man, even Carlos Gardel. In turn, Cafishio beats any woman, even the Viejita. When Garufa appears, there is a party and the one who wins the trick has to give it away. Misteriosa Mascarita is a card with gender to define, will it be male, will it be papusa?

The game is learned quickly and its rules barely occupies the first four pages of the book. The rest of the volume links pieces of tangos, memorable lyrics that act as background music for the game, breathing life into it and giving thickness to each card.

—description from the book back cover


¡Juéguese un tango!

A partir de las historias que cuentan las letras de tango nació Tango de Mente, una nueva baraja y un pasatiempo para practicar entre amigos.

Sentados los jugadores a la mesa, las cartas van y vienen. Cuando se juega Curda, los valores se invierten y un número menor pasa a ganarle a uno mayor. Donde aparece el Chanta no gana la mejor carta, sino la que le sigue en valor. Muñeca Brava le gana a cualquier hombre, incluso a Carlos Gardel. A su vez, Cafishio le gana a cualquier mujer, incluso a la Viejita. Cuando aparece Garufa, hay fiesta y el que gana la baza tiene que regalarla. Misteriosa mascarita es una carta con sexo a definir, ¿será varón, será papusa?

El juego se aprende rápido y su reglamento ocupa apenas las cuatro páginas iniciales del libro. El resto del volumen liga retazos de tangos, letras memorables que hacen de música de fondo para la partida, soplándole vida y dándole espesor a cada naipe.

—Spanish description

Name: Tawantinsuyu: The Golden Age
Description:
Pachacuti’s leadership allows the people of Cuzco to build their empire faster, better, and further than it was possible ever before. A new class of citizenry emerges: nobles, supporting their great leader with their wisdom and riches. If you hope to be Pachacuti’s successor and maintain the level of prosperity currently known to our people, keep these nobles happy and build them palaces worthy of their status! Sounds of your constructions will echo far and wide beyond the mountain ranges of Antikuna, inspiring newcomers to travel east to bask in your glory. While the priests debate whether they should follow the path of Ruruy (growth, fruit bearing) or Simpa (braiding, entwining) to worship the sun god Inti, your advisors tell you to look to the four suyu (region) you’ve conquered. Not just for plunder, but to learn from these vassal nations, and use their expertise to bring glory to the Inca. Do you have what it takes to be the leader of the Realm of the Four Parts in this Golden Age?

This expansion contains 4 modules:

     The “Way of the Sun” module introduces two alternative layouts for the Sun Temple.
     The “Vassals of the Inca” module introduces a new secondary action that lets you utilize the specialties of the other nations your armies (or other players’ armies) conquer.
     The “Nobles and Newcomers” module is the largest of the new modules, and it introduces a number of new features: a new Building type, newcomer workers, and several new Passive Buildings
     The “Pachamama” module is an improved and streamlined solo opponent for the game, based on (and replacing) Axomamma.
     Additionally, this expansion contains 8 new Passive Buildings, that can be added to the game regardless of playing with any of the modules or not.


—description from the publisher

Name: Tipni si!: Česko
Description:
You don't have to have a bloated head like a balloon in the Take a Guess! You just need a good guess or try your luck. How many people write in the Czech Republic with their left hand? How deep is Macocha? How many times has Karel ÄŒapek been nominated for the Nobel Prize? The game is packed with lots of interesting facts, curiosities and records, so you only need to get at least three players and you can start betting.

Players bet on the dates, population, area and many other variables, earning points for the right tip or for betting on the opponent's correct tip.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Nemusíte mít hlavou nafouklou vÄ›domostmi jako balón, v párty hÅ™e Tipni si! ÄŒesko staÄí dobrý odhad nebo zkusit štÄ›stí. Kolik lidí píše v ÄŒesku levou rukou? Jak hluboká je Macocha? Kolikrát byl Karel ÄŒapek nominován na Nobelovu cenu? Hra je napÄ›chovaná spoustou zajímavostí, kuriozit a rekordÅ¯, takÅ¾e staÄí sehnat alespoÅˆ tÅ™i hráÄe a mÅ¯Å¾ete se pustit do tipování.

HráÄi tipují letopoÄty, poÄty obyvatel, rozlohu a spoustu dalších veliÄin, pÅ™iÄemÅ¾ body získávají za správný tip nebo za to, Å¾e vsadili na správný tip soupeÅ™e.

V této párty hÅ™e na vás Äeká 1188 otázek rozdÄ›lených do 6 okruhÅ¯ - ZemÄ›pis, DÄ›jiny, Kultura, PÅ™íroda, Sport a RÅ¯zné. Tipni si ÄŒesko je moÅ¾né zkombinovat se základní hrou Tipni si.

—description from the publisher

Name: わたしがシンデレラ！ (Watashi Ga Cinderella)
Description:
ã‚ãŸã—ãŒã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ‡ãƒ¬ãƒ©ï¼ (Watashi Ga Cinderella) is a tile placement game from Japan. Players are Cinderella's, trying to gather their things and get to the palace first. A Cinderella needs her coach, glass slippers and ballgown. These sit in different places in the forest, and Cinderella must walk around the forest and collect them.

Players take turns to lay down tiles showing paths in the forest. Pathways must connect, and on some cards are the three treasures. At the top is the Palace, and the path leads there. Players place tiles and move their piece around, until they have crossed the three treasures and head for the Palace. The first to get there complete wins.
user summary

Name: Egyszer volt...
Description:
Once upon a time… not a literature quiz! Focus on the stories! We ask you to write your own bestseller!

Just like in an unforgettable novel, there are big laughs or even deep conversations waiting for you in this game. Once upon a time, there was no one - there was once a character you bring to life…, a dramatic turn that no one expects…, and the end result that puts the crown on your work. Creativity, playfulness, communication, imagination - all of which you will need in this great party game where the story can only be limited by your own imagination. Move the threads skillfully and be the best storyteller on your team!

The game lasts for 10 rounds. The first 9 rounds have 3 phases, Inspiration, Writing, and Evaluation.
In the Inspiration phase, we draw 2 characters, 2 dramas and 2 end cards to the playing field.
In the Writing phase, each player thinks about which combination of 3 cards they think could make the most interesting story. It is important that you choose one of each category.

Everyone will write on their page the letter combinations (for example, BAA) of the selected pages next to the current round number.
In the first three rounds, the text of the selected Character Cards is recorded, in rounds 4-6 the text of the selected Drama card, and in rounds 7-9 the text of the End Card.

In the Rating phase, players receive points for each of their teammates who have selected the same letter combination for their story. If exactly the same combination is written, everyone gets 4 points, if only the first 2 letters match, 2 points, if only the first letter matches, 1 point goes. No points are awarded if the first letter of the letter combination does not match anyone.

The tenth round is the Synopsis. In this round, we do not put new cards on the game board, but the Inspiration phase takes place from the texts of the previously selected cards. So in the Inspiration phase, we write the final story from the text of the 3-3-3 inspiration cards previously written on the scorecard.
As everyone completes in a row, tell the Final Story one after the other. Don’t forget to give the story a title.
After telling the Final Story, players secretly give each other points. Everyone can split 7 points among the other players, we give the most to the one who we think invented the best story.
After telling the story, everyone adds up the victory points earned during the 9+1 rounds.

Name: Şokopop
Description:
Ask your friends about 90's Turkish pop culture. One person becomes the judge and reads the card. Who ever answers first gets the point. Most Points wins the game!

—user summary

Kavga, polemik, basitlik, skandal...Hepsi bir kutuda bir araya geldi! Åžokopop ekibi, siz ve kankeytolarÄ±nÄ±zÄ±n eÄŸlenerek magazin bilgilerinizi yarÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rmanÄ±z için kolay, orta ve zor olmak üzere toplam 200 soru çÄ±kardÄ±. Size de oynamak ve sürpriz joker kartlarla uzmanlÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ±zÄ± kanÄ±tlamak kaldÄ±. ÅžansÄ±nÄ±z bol olsun!

—description from the publisher

Name: シティコネクト (City Connect)
Description:
ã‚·ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚³ãƒã‚¯ãƒˆ (City Connect) is a city building game from Japan. Players draw from a draft and lay out city cards in their own tableaus. The cards are in 10 different types. Each card has costs, paid for by the cards built before, and gives the city more benefits. Players aim to build monument cards too, and to get majority bonuses. Players win by gaining the most victory points.
user summary

Name: Die Olchis: Müffel-Knüffel
Description:
This game is a Yahtzee variant for kids.

The dice contain icons instead of numbers, and special dice combinations need to be played.

The game is designed with the "Olchis", a green family of creatures designed by Erhard Dietl.
Families: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

Name: Papillon Gardens
Description:
It’s time to welcome the butterflies back to your garden as Spring is finally here! With an empty field in front of you, you’ll need a steady hand and a keen eye to arrange the most beautiful garden! Add features to decorate, attract critters with new plots of grass, and get help from the friendly gnomes to watch your flower garden grow in this creative and unique stamp and write for 1-100 players!

On each turn, players will select a garden card and a dice to add new platns, animals, and items to their garden and gaining them points. After 10 rounds, the points will be added up and the the player with the most points wins.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Revised Core: Dwarves of Durin Starter Deck
Description:
The proud, hardy Dwarves are known throughout Middle-earth for their tenacity, strength, and craftsmanship. From the members of the Traveling Company to the noble line of Durin, the Dwarves are a well-known and well-loved part of The Lord of the Rings lore, and now players can bring the strength of these earthen folk to their games of The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! Always at home in caves and mines, the Dwarves specialize in delving through their decks to search for treasures and play allies and attachments for fewer resources than usual. Beyond that, they can call upon their Dwarven pride and work together to steamroll any foe!

For players who are fond of the many Dwarf characters of The Lord of the Rings and their hearty fortitude, they will love the Dwarves of Durin Starter Deck! This expansion comes with a 53-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

-description from publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Revised Core – Elves of Lórien Starter Deck
Description:
The nimble, graceful Elves are known throughout Middle-earth for their beauty and adaptability. The Wood-elves of Lórien have been a powerful, influential force of good throughout history, and now players can bring the grace and might of the Elves to their games of The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! Masters of cooperation and ambush tactics, the Wood-elves specialize in having a multitude of allies with one-use abilities that they can return to their hand to use again and again.

For players who are fond of the graceful Elves of The Lord of the Rings and their incredible adaptability, they will love the Elves of Lórien Starter Deck! This expansion comes with a 53-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

-description from publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Revised Core: Defenders of Gondor Starter Deck
Description:
The Kingdom of Gondor has been beset by enemies for centuries. Constantly under the threat of Mordor, the people of Gondor have grown into stalwart defenders of the Free Peoples, and now players can experience the unyielding will of the Gondorians as they arrive in The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. These proud warriors stand tall in the face of adversity, which is reflected in their high-risk, high-reward abilities and tendency to be strongest while threat is high.

For players who enjoy come-from-behind victories and never backing down, they will love the Defenders of Gondor Starter Deck! This expansion comes with a 53-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

-description from publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Revised Core: Riders of Rohan Starter Deck
Description:
The noble warriors of Rohan, the Rohirrim, have always been renowned for their cavalry. Masters of horses and friends of Gondor, the riders of Rohan charge into battle against the Enemy with a great rallying cry, and now players can experience the thrill of this charge in The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. The Rohirrim focus on powerful hit-and-run tactics, dashing into and out of battle in a gameplay style reminiscent of a cavalry charge.

For players who enjoy having unrelenting momentum and constantly pressuring their foes, they will love the Riders of Rohan Starter Deck! This expansion comes with a 53-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

—description from publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Fri-Ho-Di Würfel-Spiel
Description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. Published to celebrate 50 years of Homann Margarine.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game board shows the production process of "Homann Margarine".

Name: Pin 2 Win!
Description:
Pin 2 Win! combines Bible trivia with 7 life skill categories (camping, health & fitness, recreation, world missions, arts & crafts, Bible facts, nature).

Players roll the dice to move around the track. They must answer a questions in the subject of the space they land on, collecting merits tokens and pins.

The first player get to the collect seven merit tokens and a pin wins the game!

Name: Ship of the Line
Description:
As admiral of the fleet, you command your 3 captains in battle on the high seas. Though the wind may be against you at times, you can still use it to your advantage. Try to find the vulnerable spots to destroy or capture the enemy! Outmaneuver your opponent using naval tactics governed by the wind.

This game is based on the British and French battleships that fought each other during the Napoleanic Wars, and uses the sailing concepts, strategies and idioms of that period.

The 3D ships consist of a hull, 3 masts with 3 sails on each, 10 guns, and a wheel/rudder. As the ship takes hits, parts are removed from the ship. Each player has 3 ships and tries to cripple, capture or destroy his opponent.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: そして深海魚は０になる (And The Deep Sea Fish Becomes Zero)
Description:
ãã—ã¦æ·±æµ·é­šã¯ï¼ã«ãªã‚‹ (Soshite Shinkaigyo ha 0 ninaru) is a card game from Japan, and means something like 'And The Deep Sea Fish Becomes Zero'. Players are trying to get their tableau of cards down to the lowest total. If a top and bottom row card match, those two equal zero. At the end of the game, the lowest total score wins.

The deck is numbered 1 to 8, with one 1, two 2s, three 3s and so on. Each number is a different sea creature.

Players have a tableau of six cards face-down in two rows of three. Two are turned up and the highest total starts. On their turn, a player draws either from the deck or from the discard pile. The player then uses the drawn card to replace an existing card in their tableau. The new card goes face-up, the old card goes face-up to the discard. If the player drew from the draw pile, they can discard it instead.

In this way, cards gradually get turned up. The game ends when either the draw deck is exhausted, or a player has all six cards face-up. The totals are calculated, and the lowest total wins.

However, the game has certain twists. For example, the 4 card is actually -4. The 5 card forces another player to turn up a card, possibly ending the sooner. Sharks must be placed as shown on the shark card, and so on.

Because there are more high number cards, it is harder to get the score down. But players have more chances to match pairs and make them go to zero.
user summary

Name: Foundations of Rome: Monuments Expansion
Description:
As the city of Rome continues to grow, so too do the ambitions of its architects. With population and commerce on the rise, the architects of Rome have set out to bring the Eternal City to new heights of glory. Romulus, our legendary king and founder, has spared no expense providing the materials to build epic Monuments to honor our gods, our citizens and our king. Soon Rome will be shining brighter than ever before!

The Foundation of Rome: Monuments Expansion adds a new, limited pool of shared Buildings that only the most talented architects can construct. Monuments are available for any player to build and are constructed just like Buildings from a player's personal supply. However, each Monument is unique and, once constructed, is no longer available for other players to build. Monuments are powerful, but many of these epic Buildings have special requirements that must be met before construction.

—description from publisher

Name: Run & Gun
Description:
A frenetic 90’s action movies inspired Print And Play board game, with App enhancement, for 2 to 6 players.
A first person shooter tabletop app powered print & play game.

A game of Run & Gun unfolds in a series of rounds. The app keeps track of the number of rounds and informs you when the final round arrives.

Each round involves two phases: the Run and the Gun phase. Run takes place in real time and is assisted by the app: during that phase you will try to take the action that interests you the most for the second phase (and I say try because another player could take it first!). The second phase plays out in rounds, starting with the player that has the carrot card. The players resolve one by one the actions they have selected in the previous phase.

Players get points when they complete the 3 types of goals. On the other hand, they can lose points depending on the amount of damage they received during the game.

At the end of the final round, the player who earned the most points, wins.

Name: Railroad Ink: Additional Cards Pack
Description:
The Additional Cards Pack bring a lot of new content to your Railroad Ink experience:

Expansion Goal Cards – A set of 15 new goal cards, containing three cards for Portal, River, Lake, Lava, and Meteor expansion.
Blueprint Cards – A set of 9 Blueprint cards that provides different starting conditions to further increase the challenge!
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Inner War
Description:
Multiplayer game system, inspired by some MTG mechanics, with heavy adaptation to a hex grid system like Advanced Squad Leader.

Each player controls a group of units, heroes and monsters trying to exploit every stat and ability in order to overcome the enemy group.

Depending on the game mode, you win by controlling certain parts of the map, or by destroying the enemy commander, or even by simply destroying every unit in the enemy group.

—description from the designer

Name: Euromoney
Description:
For several years you have been experimenting with nanotechnological materials, in particular with graphene, you manage to discover an efficient way to produce it, you get the capital to start a business and you choose to focus on the European Union markets... but you are not the only one! The next few years will be key to position itself.

In a first phase, the participants will choose the countries in which they will initially invest and decide on their headquarters.

They will only be able to stay in a country, which manages to position itself better in the market, after checking the return on the initial investment (which is determined with a minigame of skill and fortune, the CT or coin toss).

Then the actions phase begins, where each player can perform one action per round, such as reinvesting in an already dominated market, conquering a free market, or attacking a market dominated by another player (all will be defined with the CT).

The final score is determined at the end of the fifth round, the participants will receive points according to the initial investment, the countries they dominate, according to the final value and their sizes, in addition to the bonus for maintaining the main venue or those that may have been obtained by a launch in the Kanchis sector (seven).


Desde hace varios años estás experimentando con materiales nanotecnológicos, en particular con el grafeno, lográs descubrir una forma eficiente de producirlo, consigues el capital para lanzarte a emprender y eliges concentrarte en los mercados de la Unión Europea... pero no eres el único! Los próximos años serán clave para posicionarse.

En una primera fase, los participantes elegirán los países en los que invertirán inicialmente y decidirán cuál es su sede central.

Sólo podrán quedarse en un país, quien logre posicionarse mejor en el mercado, luego de comprobar el rendimiento de la inversión inicial (que se determina con un minijuego de habilidad y fortuna, el LM o lanzamiento de monedas).

Luego comienza la fase de acciones, en donde cada jugador podrá realizar una acción por ronda, como reinvertir en un mercado ya dominado, conquistar a un mercado libre, o atacar a un mercado dominado por otro jugador (todas se definirán con el LM).

El puntaje final se determina al finalizar la quinta ronda, los participantes recibirán puntos según la inversión inicial, los países que dominen, de acuerdo al valor final y los tamaños del mismo, además del bonus por mantener la sede principal o de los que pudieran haber sido obtenidos por algún lanzamiento en el sector Kanchis (siete).

Name: Hivemind
Description:
Hivemind is a reimplementation of The Mind, using Looney pyramids instead of cards. Hivemind is a real-time cooperative game where no communication is allowed (any sounds, gestures, et cetera). Each player has a random set of pyramids hidden behind a screen. Players try to play these pyramids in order without knowing which pyramids the other players have, and without communicating. There are no turns, so you have to 'guess' or 'feel' when to play your pyramids.

—description from the designer

Name: Veredicto
Description:
Veredicto is a fun board game, created in Argentina, where you have to defend cases and convince other players that what you say is true, in order to win!

It's time to give your “Verdict”!!! All participants must use their ingenuity, strategy and audacity to defend a statement, whether it is true or false, and persuade the other players with arguments to win, within the dramatization of a trial where the participants will play the roles of lawyers and jury.

Players must advance and add positions to win round after round each case as lawyers or by getting their verdicts right as a jury, until someone manages to win the game.

The game is innovative and contains a large dose of entertainment because the players learn from each case and have fun watching the lawyers argue in each case. In turn, the participants test their knowledge, in a unique dynamic where everyone plays all the time.

How to play?

The plot of the game is novel and captivating. Players take on the role of lawyers and - indicated by a card - must argue for the truth or falsity of a statement, trying to convince the other players (the "jury") to lean towards their defense.

It's a game for 3 to 6 players or teams where you'll be a lawyer and you'll have to defend unusual cases and convince the rest that your argument is true in order to beat your opponent. The objective of the game is to win as many cases as possible to move up in your career before the rest do. Each lawyer must defend a position regarding an affirmation, convincing the rest that what he says is correct.

Name: eMEMO Europe
Description:
EMemo is a memory game. Match the photos from locations around Europe and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

Challenging memory fun. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

—user summary

Name: The Carniverse
Description:
Imagine a world where you are no longer the top of the food chain. A world where society has fallen, governments cease to function, and countries fall into chaos. A new primeval world where the surviving members of humankind must band together in order to fight for their existence over scarce resources.
 A new world filled with hungry, feral dinosaurs.
 This is the world of The Carniverse. Will you lead your team of survivors to victory against their foes? Or will they become just another snack for the new gods of our planet?

This is a scenario-driven miniatures skirmish game played on a 3'x3' surface with terrain features. Each player controls a team of survivors battling against other teams of survivors for resources while trying to not get eaten by dinosaurs. Each team has specific skills and abilities. They are created based on available Resource Points.
Each game is divided up into five phases that make up a single game turn when combined. 
The phases that make up a single turn are:

     The Dino Phase
     The Movement Phase
     The Shooting Phase
     The Melee Phase
     The End Phase


When the last phase is finished, the cycle begins again until any victory or loss conditions for the scenario are met.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tallywood Rally
Description:
In Tallywood Rally, you will be in charge of your own halfling political campaign. Leverage the plans up your sleeve into clever plays: send assistants to rally and fundraise—increasing your popularity and treasury, pander to voters directly, build public works, and work with celebrities to get out the vote.

To take their turns, players will be using an innovative card mechanism which allows them to control the actions of their workers. Cards are played into one of four action columns, each with three possible spaces. Each unique space connects the icons on the cards in a different way, potentially revealing bonuses on the board itself. These action include:

     Secure Funding: Construct a Public Works tile in this district to attract voters and increase your influence.
     Celebrity Endorsement: Attract a celebrity endorsement to help get out the vote, increasing your polling in that district, and attracting new voters.
     Research: Reveal the effects of a Celebrity of Public Work tile in a district, gaining support in the process.
     Appeal: Spend your Popularity (credibility) to make a direct appeal to the voters of a District, increasing your polling and your vote share at game’s end.


After four weeks of campaigning the final vote is held! Voters are assigned to districts, players total up their vote shares in each district, and the player with the most votes wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Bug On The Motherboard
Description:
You are a fly stuck in a computer!

Roll dice to move about the motherboard to collect Energy. Use that energy to power up the computer components (cpu, graphics card, etc.) and use capacitors to strategically assemble the components on your motherboard for extra points, but watch out! Resistors can pop and you can cause a short circuit and get Zapped!

Can you fully assemble your Motherboard before you get fried?! Or get some of your techy friends and compete to build you motherboard or varying boards and score the most points!

—description from the designer

Name: Questo
Description:
Your goal in Questo is to score as many words as possible, but the letters are presented in random order, so good luck fitting them all together.

Each player has a 6x6 game board and a set of letters. A set of red letters are placed in the center of play available to all. One player shuffles the deck of 36 cards, then reveals the top card. If the card shows a letter, everyone takes this letter from their set and places it somewhere on their grid, either face up as the letter or face down as a block (similar to a black space in a crossword puzzle). If the card shows "FREE" — a designation on the J, Q, X, and Z — then you can instead choose a red letter from the center area to add to your grid.

After all 36 cards have been revealed, score any words that you have created when you read your grid left to right and top to bottom, with each letter in each word being worth 1 point. Letters that are not part of a word are worth 0 points, and if every combination of letters on your grid forms a word, then you have created a "perfect square" and score 12 bonus points.

The rules suggest playing multiple games until someone passes 500 points. Questo can also be played as a solo game, with a player trying for the best score possible, with 52+ being quite difficult.

Name: Nidavellir: Thingvellir – Crovax and Odroerir Promo Cards
Description:
Rules:
- Crovax the Döppelgänger
Crovax is a neutral Hero that adds 25 points to your Final Bravery Value.
Put him in your Command Zone and discard immediately the last dwarf card from the column of your choosing.
It is the same power as Bonfur, so all rules that apply for Bonfur are to be applied for Corvax.

- Odroerir, the Mythic Cauldron
During set-up, put Odroerir aside.
Shuffle the Age 2 Camp cards, then put Odroerir on the top of the deck. Therefore, at the beginning of Age 2, Odroerir will be amongst the 5 available Camps cards. As soon as an Elvaland takes a card from the camp, put the smallest coin available from the Royal Treasure on Odroerir.
Do this until an Elvaland takes the Odroerir card with the coins on it.
The Odroerir card with its coins goes in the Command Zone.
At the end of the game, Odroerir adds the sum of all the coins on it to your Final Bravery Value.


Tom and the Hat promo cards were originally from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign and are identical to Crovax and Odroerir aside from the names and artwork.

Name: Ascent: Give rise to an Empire
Description:
It is time to conquer a new frontier. As global overseer you have ambitious plans for your expansion into the galaxy, but space is large and there are many contenders to deal with. From the peaceful Alliance to the insect-like Swarm or the warrior race Kthuani. Do you have what it takes to emerge victorious from the  galactic power struggle?

Ascent is a solitaire, 4x, sci-fi, roll and write game in which you must explore your local sector, discover and lay claim to new systems and their resources, defeat your enemies in battle and trade with your allies (or destroy them too).

The game is played over a series of turns divided into 6 phases. During each turn you’ll gather resources, explore space and colonize star systems, construct new structures to progress your colonies, improve your armada and advance your political agenda.

Win the game by efficiently managing your commodities and time in order to pursue one of the 3 different, species-specific, winning conditions (Goals).

Once you complete any one of your goals the game ends and, optionally, you can determine your final score.

Will you be remembered as an all-powerful leader? A grand merchant? A warmonger? A political genius? Or something entirely different?

—description from the designer

Name: Mini Meeple Melee
Description:
"Big Battles, Tiny Tin!"

Mini Meeple Melee is a combat arena game you can carry anywhere! 2-4 players select from 6 unique classes and battle in 1 of 3 different modes to the death. You can fight in free-for-all fights, team matches, or boss battles. For such a small package, the battlefield is surprisingly modular. Select your terrain, place the crates and magic circles, and position the tins. Then you're ready to drop in and start brawling!

Each turn you can perform 2 actions. Basic actions include moving, resting, or taking cover. You can also use 1 of your characters unique skills, usually to attack your opponents.

This game is quick, fun, & simple. So it's great for anyone, anytime, anywhere!

—description from the publisher

Name: Champions of Midgard: Polyhedral Dice Promo Tiles
Description:
Military and economic promo tiles that were sold with a limited-edition custom made complete polyhedral dice set.

The two promo tiles are:

Varangian Guard: Roll the die on this tile and collect Viking dice based on the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (The Varangian Guard was a Viking military unit that served as personal bodyguards to the Byzantine Emperors.)

Taflkast House: Roll the die on this tile and collect Glory equal to the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (Taflkast is a Viking dice game.)

Name: Yummy Yummy Pancake: Promo Pancake Tokens
Description:
Three all new varieties of pancake tokens to add to your Yummy Yummy Pancake game! Play with the normal rules, OR enjoy some NEW rules variations to make the game a little more difficult or to mix it up a little!

The new pancake flavors are:

Caramel Apple Pecan
Ice Cream & Chocolate Sauce
Wild Berry
The tokens come with ONE new set of rules.

Name: Gadget Grid
Description:
Two ten-sided dice determine both the initial placements of player tokens and the placements of Gadget Cards throughout the game. Setup takes less than a minute and gameplay is simple and fast-paced. 2-8 players scramble around a 10x10 board collecting Gadget Cards that can alter the layout of the board, enhance their own abilities, change existing conditions, or - most importantly - attack other players. Attacks remove one of three "Life Gizmos" from a player. Players battle until only one person has any Life Gizmos left.

During a turn, players will move around the board collecting Gadget Crates. They can play Actions, spawn new Gadget cards, or move any player token that does not have Life Gizmos. At the end of their turn, they can Attack other players, removing one Life Gizmo from every target they hit.

When a player is reduced to 0 Life Gizmos, they can no longer collect or use Gadget Cards, but can still move around the board and damage other players. If they manage to get to a player who still has Life Gizmos, they steal one of them and can continue gathering and playing Gadget Cards as normal. Gameplay continues until Life Gizmos have been removed from all but one player.

—description from the designer

Name: Calabozo: Una nueva aventura
Description:
The four legendary dragons have been stripped of their sacred gems and require the help of intrepid adventurers who are experts in combat, each dragon will qualify the most suitable to fulfil the mission and as help, they will receive a legendary weapon, not counting the magical elements that can obtain during your adventure.

You must rescue six sacred gems and return them to the dragon that recruited them before the other adventurers

You move around the grid rolling the normal dice, you must defeat the wolves along the way, and keep moving until you find an enemy creature, the combat is done with custom attack dice and a damage track.
If you defeat the creature, you get one of the sacred gems.

Name: Usurpers
Description:
The King is a formidable ruler, whose strength and cunning have not been matched in a generation. But he is away on a diplomatic visit to another realm... now is your chance to seize the throne! 

Take control of his legion troops and he will be ill equipped to stand against you.

Master the dark arts and summon a demon and he dare not oppose you.

Infiltrate his court and turn his own advisors against him and he will be powerless to stand in your way.

But, if he returns before you accomplish one of those things, kiss your ambitions good-bye.

Will you have the best reputation among the guilds when the king returns?

Apotheosis is a worker placement game where each of your workers have a type and a level. Many of the worker spaces care about one, the other, or both of those attributes. Blocking is a big dynamic in worker placement games, and in this one you are allowed to use a space as long as your worker is at least tied for the highest level there when you place it. This means there's not as much blocking at the beginning of the game, but as players level their workers up, blocking (and therefor placement tension) becomes more and more of a thing.

—description from the designer

Name: Keeping Up With The Joneses
Description:
One-up your neighbors in 6 different aspects of life, while trying to keep up with the Joneses up the street, who really seem to have everything together!

In this rondel game, each space on the rondel has a track representing a life aspect you can compete in: Job, Home, Kids, Cars, Charity, and Social. When you land on a space, you advance that track. Occasionally, an aspect will score in a majority fashion (farthest up the track gets 1st reward, etc), but if you are too far behind the Jones marker, then you don't gain any status!

—description from the designer

Name: Game of Trumps
Description:
Game of Trumps is a trick-taking card game for four players.  It is played in partnerships, but what sets this game apart is that players do not know who their partners are at the beginning of the round!  The partnerships are revealed over the course of the round through card play.

The deck consists of four suits: Circles, Squares, Triangles, and Trumps.  The Trump suit has cards numbered 1 to 14, while the other three suits are numbered 1 to 6.

There is no bidding, and play proceeds like most trick-taking games, with one player leading a suit and other players following if they can.  Certain cards are worth points if they are taken as part of a trick.

The player or players that have the top two trump cards are on one team, and the rest of the players are on the other.  This is not revealed before the round, but through normal card play.

At the end of the round, each player scores points based on how their team did during the round.  The first player to 10 points wins!

Name: エジプトウォール (Egypt Wall)
Description:
ã‚¨ã‚¸ãƒ—ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ« (Egypt Wall) is a game from Japan. Players are constructing Egyptian wall murals. Players can choose cards to add to their panel, or to improve the way their panel scores. Balancing the choices is a challenge.

The game has a set of score cards laid out in a column, and panel cards depicting various Egyptian characters laid alongside each score card. As players take panel cards, they place their own cubes on the scoring section of the score card.

When a player takes a new panel card, it is placed at either end of their display, or between existing cards. But players cannot shuffle the cards around as they like.

The panels depict various figures, some holding decorated items, some showing their eyes, some facing to the left or right. As the panel builds up, players want to optimise their scoring with the right panels in the right place.

Some scoring cards have limits that must be exceeded or restricted, such as more than 3 of one image, or fewer than 7. Some cards have very particular scoring, such as create a line of mummy, eye, eye, woman. The mix of figures on the panels and the mix of scoring needs creates a difficult choice for players.

The game is played over two rounds, and the player with the highest score at the end is the winner.

The second edition had some tweaks to the rules and the card contents to improve gameplay.
user summary

Name: Furtivo
Description:
Strategy game for two players.

The object of Sneaky is to be the first player to capture all five of your opponent's checkers.

The game has two dice, one of movement (from 1 to 3) and another Furtive dice, empty on five sides and with an eye on the sixth. The player will roll the dice secretly and will be able to lie about the result, being able to play a "bluff".

-------------------------------------------------------------------Juego de estrategia para dos jugadores.
El objetivo de Furtivo es ser el primer jugador en capturar las cinco fichas del oponente.
El juego dispone de dos dados, uno de movimiento (de 1 a 3) y otro dado Furtivo, vacío en cinco caras y con un ojo en la sexta.
El jugador tirará los dados de forma secreta y podrá mentir sobre el resultado, pudiendo jugar un “farol”.

Name: Gaudeamus!: Zbuduj średniowieczny uniwersytet
Description:
Travel back in time to medieval Cracow and become one of the historical personages: Queen Jadwiga of Anjou, King WÅ‚adysÅ‚aw JagieÅ‚Å‚o, King Casimir the Great, or Cardinal Zbigniew OleÅ›nicki. Build the first Polish university and make it famous all over Europe!

The action of the game takes place at the turn of the 15th and 16th centuries, in the heyday of the University of Krakow. The goal of the game is to found a university with 4 faculties: liberal arts, medicine, law, and theology. The first player to create all of them wins. To build a faculty, a player must collect the required cards and pay its cost.

In each game round, players take their turns consecutively. During single turn, the player first draws and resolves the effect of a Random Event card, and then performs one of the available actions:
a) opening a faculty (if the player meets the requirements),
b) exchange of up to 3 cards from hand,
c) using a special card and resolving its effect,
d) buying a card from the board.
At the end of the round, players bid for new action cards and collect coins from the faculties that are already running.

Name: Who Killed Robert Prentice
Description:
Through the use of clues the reader and Lieutenant John Milton Schwab of the Florida Police attempt to solve the mystery surrounding the death by poisoning of a wealthy British businessman.

Crime Dossier 2 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

Name: Ice Barrier
Description:
You are a small troop of 20 people who reached a sheltered valley a good 12,000 years ago. As winter approaches, you disagree on how to proceed: some of you want to risk it and move south across the ice barrier, another prefers to stay and wait, and the third thinks it best to go straight back to the old home. One evening you will come together to make a decision.

You lead one of the three groups and want to enforce your opinion with your 6 people. To do this, you take turns placing character cards between you and one of the other two groups so that one half of the card faces towards you and the other half faces the rival group. One half of the card has a numerical value that shows how convincing the person is in the discussion. With the other half, you use the person's special ability. So you always have to decide which side you want to benefit from and which side you might concede to another camp.

With these special abilities you can swap cards, turn them, or even knock other tribe members unconscious. This also allows you to influence the row of cards between the other two, because otherwise you can only place cards to the left or right of you, but not opposite.

When all the cards are played, see which of you won this primitive debate. To do this, you add up the numbers that are facing you to the left and right. Your rivals claim the other halves of the cards for themselves. The one who could collect the most points after three rounds has prevailed over the others and decides the further fate of the troop.

Additionally needed: 2 chips to mark the people protected by the warrior.

Name: Gartenparty
Description:
You're having a summer party in the garden. A few friends arrive early in the afternoon to help with the preparations: Beer tables are dragged, tablecloths laid out and space made for the drinks. In one corner of the garden, however, a loud competition breaks out over who will hang the most beautiful string of lights. Who will hang the coolest fairy lights at your garden party?

All cards show three power lines with light bulbs and lanterns of different colors hanging from them. You place one of them in front of you as your own starting card. The rest of the cards are placed in the center of the table. Look at them carefully, because it's all about speed! Once you've all placed one hand flat on the table, you're ready to go.

You grab cards with only one hand at a time, as fast as you can, and place them on your string of lights. Also make sure that the power lines are not always straight. This can get lost in the heat of the moment. You can also flip cards, because maybe the back side will be more useful. But you have to put your hand flat on the table again before you can return to the action.

Whoever has laid the required length first, depending on the number of players, gives the signal to the others to come to the end. Now you can see who has really conjured up the best string of lights:

The more light bulbs and lanterns of the same color follow each other in a line, the more points the chain of lights earns you. The lanterns are particularly valuable because, unlike light bulbs, they also count individually and even double the point value if they are part of a row. When your arms are unknotted and your eyes are no longer spinning, you can immediately start the next round.

It's game 17 of the series "Die Kleinen Feinen".

Name: Die Bremer
Description:
Fairy tales are just fairy tales after all! In reality, Donkey, Dog, Cat and Rooster are the first professional gang of gangsters and are up to mischief in the otherwise quiet Bremen. Luckily, the police stand in their way!

You get three cards in your hand, only whoever plays the first card gets four cards. Then you try to form rows of cards from 0 to 4. To do this, you always place the next highest or next lowest card.

If you have a card in the same color, you may skip values. Since you are not allowed to fill up this gap, rows can remain incomplete.

If you cannot or do not want to play a card, you must pass and take a card from the draw pile into your hand. You may play this card directly. When a row is finished - whether complete or not - or everyone in the round has passed, the round is over. Whoever placed the last card of the row gets the lowest card in his hand and starts the next round. All other cards in the row are discarded.

Once the draw pile is empty, you may only pass if you really can't play. Whichever of you has no card left in his or her hand when he or she would have to play a card, wins the round. The losers then receive one minus point for each card in their hand, two for a policeman. Whoever has collected the fewest minus points at the end of a certain number of rounds wins the game.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Town Musicians of Bremen

Name: No Time For Prayer: The Battles of Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip
Description:
Come Mr. Osbon, this is not the time for prayer!
--Admiral Farragut, to flag officer Osbon, who was kneeling on the USS Hartford’s main deck preparing a shell fuse during the battle of Forts Jackson and Philip.

No Time For Prayer details the battles for the port and city of New Orleans; Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip.

The battles to take control of New Orleans were not easy ones. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Players will also need one standard deck of playing cards, a six-sided die and one ten sided die to play the game. A die roll of 0 is read as 10 and not zero.

Name: Kommissar Rex und seine Freunde!
Description:
A Quizgame featuring the famous TV-Dog REX, regarding everything from the TV series and dogs in general.

The areas of knowledge are series, lineage, training, husbandry, behavior and breeding.

Name: Lobster Roll
Description:
The Penobscot Bay off the coast of Maine produces a yearly bounty of saltwater fish, shellfish, and lobsters. This solitaire roll-and-write game lets players become commercial fishers, seeking the largest and best catches of these valuable seafoods. It’s a risky endeavor, requiring proper timing, thoughtful management of your resources, and a bit of old-fashioned good luck.

Choose your location, roll your dice, and see what you've caught. If you succeed, sell your catch strategically to earn top dollar. If you don't succeed, use your failures wisely, to improve your operation for next season.

This is a solitaire, print-and-play, roll-and-write design. The game comes with rulebook, map sheet, and record sheet. The only other bits required are three dice: one each in green, red, and blue.

The game takes about 45 minutes (15 minutes for each of three rounds), and is appropriate for ages 10 and up.

Name: Bad News On the Doorstep: The Battle of Kontum, May 1972
Description:
“The poor display of any will to fight by the [ARVN] 22nd Division at Tan Canh is discouraging and makes the defense of Kontum City difficult to foretell… In light of this there is little basis for confidence that Hue or Kontum will be held.” –General Creighton Abrams to Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird.

Following the 1971 defeat of the ARVN (Army of the Republic of South Vietnam) in their Operation Lam Son 719 offensive in Laos it was very apparent the US policy of “Vietnamization” was in serious trouble, The North Vietnamese High Command walked away from the Paris Peace Talks during the fighting and advanced their plans for an all-out offensive against South Vietnam.

In April 1972 the North Vietnamese and their Communist allies in the South, the National Liberation Front (NLF), launched a broad offensive, code named Nguyen Hue (name of the Vietnamese leader who defeated Chinese invaders in 1789) against the ARVN in South Vietnam from their strongholds in the Central Highlands as well as from Laos and across the DMZ (de-militarized zone) that bordered North and South Vietnam. Dubbed the “Easter Offensive” by the US press, the Communist attack was the largest since those during Tet in 1968, and like that earlier offensive, the Communists hoped that the offensive would initiate insurrections throughout South Vietnam and the collapse of its government. One of the most violent battles of the Easter Offensive was fought over the town of Kontum. The central highlands town had been subject to many attacks over the years, but this was the most prolonged and unlike the earlier fights which were waged by the NLF, this was a large-scale conventional battle that included tanks and massive numbers of artillery and rocket support. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of Bad News on the Doorstep is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
104 un-mounted, double-sided units
10 pages of rules

Players will need a standard deck of cards with all Ace, 2 and 3 cards removed, one six sided (D6) and one ten sided (D10) set of dice to play the game. Treat a DR of 0 on the D10 as ten, not zero.

Name: Chess more than a game!
Description:
4 levels - 8 categories - 32 important places of chess - 512 questions: Test your knowledge concerning the history, the rules, the board and its pieces and much more around on the most popular board games in the world!

The game board shows a map of Europe with 32 places that are significant to the history of chess. Each place is displayed with a playing field containing one of eight category symbols. The starting point is Madrid, the location of the first European chess tournament in 1575. The goal is to get to Tromsö, the venue of the 2014 Chess Olympiade.

The cards are divided into eight categories: Peculiarities – Openings – Mate in 1 – Rules – Game Board & Figures – Chess Lexicon – Timeless Beauty – Quiz. Every category is positioned on the board game with its own symbol and colour. On each question card, you will find questions for four different difficulty levels: Pawn –> Knight –> Rook –> Queen. The questions are ordered from easiest to most difficult, so there is an opportunity for everyone to be involved.

Name: dice_mancala
Description:
ãƒ€ã‚¤ã‚¹ãƒžãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ© (Dice_Mancala) is a dice game from Japan. The players are dice farmers, and work hard in the dice fields harvesting dice.

Using a Kalah mechanism, players collect dice which they then use to roll and complete treasure cards. When a player has got their fourth treasure card, the game ends once everyone has had their turn. The player with the most points from their treasure and from the dice they harvested is the winner.

Whilst the active player rolls dice, and the other players also get to roll dice. The more dice the active player rolls, the better their chance to gain treasure, but the more chances the other players get too.

The designer says the game needs more than luck to win. Players make strategic choices through the game.
user summary

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au
Description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Nachmund – Vigilus Alone
Description:
The worlds of the Vigilus System have echoed to the clamour of cataclysmic war for decades, assailed not only by xenos, but also the armies of Abaddon the Despoiler. A fragile survival was bought at terrible cost – now Vigilus itself must stand or fall without its most heroic saviour.

The planet is besieged, its neighbouring systems imperilled with the Great Rift closing in. If it cannot stand, then this beleaguered bastion world and all its defenders will be damned for eternity.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 1 – Rising Tide
Description:
In the Octarius Sector, the Imperium's worst fears have been realised. For years, the Tyranids of Hive Fleet Leviathan have been locked in a war of attrition with the Orks. Now, the conflict has spilt out into surrounding space, and the xenos forces descend on Imperial planets, hungry for battle and biomatter.

The combined forces of the Deathwatch, numerous Space Marine Chapters, and the legions of the Adeptus Mechanicus rush to stem the tide of destruction that threatens to engulf the Pankallis Sub-sector in war. Not all hope is lost: Inquisitor Athocles Van Roth is brewing a plan – a high stakes endeavour that may result in the total defeat of the Tyranid forces. The Imperium must be ready to do whatever it takes to stop the Octarius Sector from falling to ruin.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

Name: ダイスマンカラ：拡張 (Dice_Mancala: Expansion)
Description:
ãƒ€ã‚¤ã‚¹ãƒžãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ©ï¼šæ‹¡å¼µ (Dice_Mancala: Expansion) is an expansion to a dice game from Japan. The expansion has two extra variants for the base game. These can be combined.

The expansion æ—¬ã®å®çŸ³ (Seasonal Jewels) is a module that gets additional points in the set collection as you collect the same colors. With simple rules, it is recommended to used as soon as you learn the base game.

The expansion æ‚©ã¿ã®ç¨® (Troublesome) adds an additional dice to get in the way when you're in the mancala phase. Players with this will lose their turn privilege and will roll the dice from the beginning. At the end of the turn, place the Troublesome dice on the board again. Make good use of it and increase the number of times you roll the dice.
publisher's summary

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 2 – Critical Mass
Description:
Hive Fleet Leviathan bears down on the Octarius sector's heart, while the critical forge world of Sigma-Ulstari fights for its life against repeated xenos invasions. As battles become desperate and the fate of billions hangs in the balance, forces on all sides marshal their deadliest weapons in preparation for the Octarian War's apocalyptic conclusion.

From the ashes of Octarius a victor will emerge, tempered in the bloodiest conflict seen in millennia, but who will it be? The Tyranids pit their finest strategic mind, the Swarmlord, against the uncompromising brutality of the Overfiend of Octarius, all while Imperial systems battle to contain the overflowing carnage.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this book.

Name: Bonnie and Clyde, Love and Death
Description:
Bonnie & Clyde, Love and Death is first and foremost a solo game that can also be played as a duo, where the goal is to find the romantic end that the couple dreamed of.

Along this road trip, you will have to choose the right actions to survive, stick up banks or stores, but also keep an eye on the gas tank and the state of your vehicle, and, of course, outrun the cops, who will only get better and better at tracking you down.

At the beginning of the game, you choose from four levels of difficulty and set out on the first country road.

Each turn represents a day divided into three phases: Morning, Afternoon, and Night.

During the game, you have to manage your resource and situation gauges. Some of them can lead to your death, such as not having any food or ammunition during a shootout; others can lead to defeat, such as having a love gauge at zero, which would lead to the separation of the couple. It is therefore important to fulfill the victory conditions before triggering any defeat condition.

In easy mode, the goal is to finish your run with a shoutout in a farmhouse, with two bank loot and your love gauge raised to the maximum before the police — or someone — kill Bonnie or Clyde.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – War Zone Nachmund Grand Tournament Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2022
Description:
This edition of Chapter Approved is the essential gaming toolbox for all fans of Warhammer 40,000 matched play. Whether you're a tournament regular or simply like to ensure your battles are always fought on an even footing, this is the essential supplement for matched play games of Warhammer 40,000. Inside this 56-page softback book, you'll find:

- Two mission packs, comprising nine missions each for Incursion and Strike Force battles, each designed to offer a different challenge to the players.

- Guidelines for setting up and playing a matched play or Grand Tournament-level competitive game, including suggested battlefield size, time limit and how best to determine secondary objectives.

- 23 secondary objectives. Some are entirely new, while others have been tweaked, or had the amount of victory points they award adjusted.

- And much, much more…

In addition, you'll also find a separate 56-page book – the Munitorum Field Manual 2022 – containing all the latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

Name: Dream Team: Partner oder Gegenspieler?
Description:
Dream Team is a quiz game in which the 2 teams are formed every turn in a new way. In this way, every player can benefit from the strengths of the other players in his team and tries to use his knowledge the best possible way by persuading the other players.

The goal of the game is to get the most victory points during the game and be the first one on the stellar target field.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Wars of Faith
Description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within this book, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the Nachmund Gauntlet, which continues to suffer under the assault of Chaos and xenos forces.

This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your campaigning forces can battle across the war-torn world of Vigilus and beyond. With Marneus Calgar seemingly slain by Abaddon the Despoiler, and the planet’s surface overrun by aliens and Heretic Astartes, will your Crusade force emerge as heroes in this time of need or be crushed beneath the boots of their enemies?

This 120-page mission pack includes:

- Six missions each for Combat Patrol-, Incursion-, Strike Force- and Onslaught-sized games, all set within the beleaguered Nachmund Gauntlet
- Wars of Faith mechanics that allow armies to earn Belief Points to purchase additional abilities
- Priests Battle Traits to be used in Wars of Faith, plus Requisitions and Agendas
- The basic rules for Warhammer 40,000 – designed to be quickly referenced during your games

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use on the tabletop during games, and it comes with an elastic closure. You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this mission pack.

Name: ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix
Description:
Celebrate 30 years of funk! ToeJam and Earl take it to the tabletop in this brand-new Rogue like Party Board Game, where players can experience new and different levels every session!

Be the first player to find and collect 3 Rocketship pieces - while not letting the Earthlings trip you up! Players roll dice and move along the track collecting rocket ship pieces and presents. Every present is different and may just give you the winning edge!

ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix is fully compatible with Yooka-Laylee and Mutant Mudds Game Decks board games! Mix and match for some truly funky results!

Name: Wabbeln
Description: Every player tries to throw his coins as near as possible to the wall. The one whose coin is the nearest wins.

Name: TropeQuest
Description:
TropeQuest pokes fun at everyone's favorite sci-fi and fantasy stereotypes and puts them literally into the hands of the players, who attempt to turn a pile of genre fiction cliches into a workable narrative. It's a creative, collaborative game with a lighthearted competitive element that uses cards and a board to make it fun and easy for players to improvise an original story. Best of all, it generates a unique tale each and every time it's played.

The board provides the story arc, a plot map that packs as many cliched scenarios and overwrought plot twists as possible into fifteen squares. The deck brings the setting... a library of genre tropes and oblique pop culture references to tickle the imaginations of geeks and laypersons alike. Players and encouraged to mix, match, and try out new combinations.

After a deck of tropes and a plot board are chosen, players are each dealt a hand of cards and take turns being the Narrator. The Narrator reads the prompt on the next available square and chooses a card from a pool of trope cards submitted by adjacent players (plus one random from the deck) to finish the prompt. While this may yield some hilarious results, the Narrator's work has not yet begun! Next, the Narrator "sells" the scene by elaborating, tying up loose ends, spicing it up a bit. Afterwards, the players redraw cards, the player whose card was picked draws an extra one, and the next player becomes the Narrator. Rinse and repeat until all fifteen squares have been played and the story has reached its thrilling climax.

So, the story is over. What was the point of it all? Well, in a way, the goal of the game is to laugh, have fun, and tell a quirky story together. However, in another, more mathematical and literal way, the goal of the game is to win by having more cards than anyone else at the end of the game. But winning also comes with great responsibility! After the gloating is over, the winner then chooses their favorite scene in the story Narrated by another player. That player then becomes the Chosen One, Master of Tropes and The Uber-Winner of that round of TropeQuest.

Name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Awakenings
Description:
A box containing the various stretch goals from the Gamefound campaign, containing:

1 Soul Harvester Boss Miniature
32 Monster Miniatures
4 Hero Miniatures
4 Deluxe Hero Boards
4 Hero Boards
5 Deluxe Dungeon Role Boards
209 Cards
24 Unique Maps
15 Folded Doors
4 Standees
More than 80 Game Tokens
1 Campaign Notepad
1 Book

Name: Two Some
Description:
In Two Some, you and another player answer the ultimate "me or you" questions to see how well you know each other, either playing with just the two of you or going head-to-head against up to three other couples.

Each round, two cards are revealed to the group, such as "avoid when hungry" and "better poker face", or perhaps "laughs at own jokes" and "knows more types of plants". Each player simultaneously chooses which of the two cards they feel they are better at than their partner. If both players on the same team choose different cards, they are on the same wavelength and score. The team with the highest score after twelve rounds wins.

Break the ice and find out whether you are the perfect pair or perfect strangers!

Name: Rising Waters
Description:
It's spring 1927, and while Americans dance the Charleston and drink bootlegged liquor, the Mississippi Delta faces a flood of epic proportions. If battered river levees collapse, everything important to you will be washed away.

Rising Waters is a co-operative board game built around area control, set collection, and variable player power mechanisms in which players are members of the African American community who are confronting two powerful and arbitrary forces: nature and the racism of white landowners. Resist by drawing on hidden strengths like your family, church, music, plots of land, and education. Can you manage the rising waters to stay alive?

Rising Waters is played on a hex-based map of the Mississippi River and surrounding lands based on the area around Vicksburg, Mississippi. The game runs over a series of rounds representing different weeks during the flood, when players have opportunities to work cooperatively and individually to save their homes, families, and communities. During the flood, work together to keep your family and neighbors alive by minimizing losses during the flood. Players must also negotiate the arbitrary demands of white landowners.

Yet African Americans weren’t solely victims in the 1927 flood–as always, they maintained a sense of agency and sources of power to survive. In the game, this comes from the Community cards, which include blues, farm animals, church, garden, family, and education cards. The cards help players upgrade their abilities during the game as well as resist racism. Rising Waters serves as a powerful illustration of the difficulty of African American lives in the Jim Crow South. Through the game, students and teachers will be able to have challenging conversations about the endemic nature of racism and how it complicates life during a crisis. If players keep below the maximum level of losses for a certain number of rounds, they've survived the worst of the flood and win the game!

Name: La mansión de Drácula
Description:
La mansión de Drácula ("Dracula's Manor") is solitaire card game where you enter Dracula's lair to find your kidnapped relatives, as long as you also try to kill the King of Vampire before it's midnight.

In every turn, the player reveals a card until he finds a room card. An Event or Relative card can also be drawn, in which case it will be activated in the next room. The player has a limited time to find among the cards their relatives. The goal of the game is to find them and/or kill Dracula before he awakes. The game ends if the player leaves the Manor, rescue their relatives or kill Dracula (win), or is killed by Dracula's minions or Dracula himself.

This fast paced card game is inspired in the modern solitaire RPG's questzines but its roots are in the 80's videogames.

Name: Within Walls
Description:
Within Walls is a Paranoia driven hidden traitor game with social deduction elements set in the early 20th century horror setting. The gameplay is heavily focused on player interaction with  intuitive rules that are designed merely as a catalyst for player interaction and serve the purpose to define available options.
You are agents sent to investigate an incident in a local sanatorium. Upon arrival on the scene you realize there is an impostor among you.
Your goal is to gather as much information as possible while making sure all witnesses remain alive for further questioning.

Move through the Story by drawing Event cards and playing them during your turn in accordance with your agenda, the mandatory play means you will be faced with several bad choices - in this game most choices are bad. As the story advances more and more clues are found about the traitor, however reaching the end of any story Act with the traitor alive means that the agents lose the game. The traitor(s) must be stopped before reaching the completion of his mission. A unique story progress board is used to mark the progress of the team as a whole while individual Mind sheets follow players' descent into inevitable madness.
The game ends either when the Agents win by discovering and eliminating the Traitor or when the Traitor wins by either eliminating all Agents or reaching the end of the story and completing his goal.
The special 2 player game mode keeps the suspense, social deduction elements and paranoia with only minor rule changes.
Included is one Investigation focus die made of wood, as imperfect as the world you are playing in and unique,, again.. as this world.

Name: Keep a Straight Face
Description:
Act, sing, and dance your way through these cringe-worthy and laughter-worthy cards. Suitable for little ones and big ones this card game is fun for the whole family! Be warned as the crack of a smile can mean losing the game.

A player spins the spinner to select another player to try to make laugh. That person then draws a card and performs the silly action printed on it, hoping to make one or more players at the table break their stoicism. If the targeted player laughs, the active player collects the card.

Collect 10 cards and you win!

Name: Big Ten Game Day
Description:
The player on offense and the player on defense each plays a card face down. Both players then flip their cards over at the same time revealing the selected plays. Once a card is played, it is discarded in a separate pile which becomes the discard pile. After each play advance the down counter to the next down unless there is a first down conversion, a scoring play, or a turnover.

The game is played in two “halves”. A half is over when there are no more cards available and neither player has a card in his hand. A half will take from 30 to 45 minutes. When the half is over, shuffle all the Offense, Defense, and Special Teams decks. Each player draws 5 cards to start the second half.

The Game is over at the end of the second half. The player with the most points wins. For a shorter game, play 1 half.

Name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Electric Whiskers – Expansion 1
